Back to Franz Liszt

Franz Liszt

Préludes et Harmonies poétiques et religieuses, S. 171d

1845–1846 · LW – · R. –

Total duration: 41'

  • 1. Prélude
  • 2. C minor
  • 3. E major
  • 4. Dernière illusion
  • 5. G-flat major
  • 6. Attente
  • 7. Alternative
  • 8. M. K.

Liszt’s Harmonies poétiques et religieuses exist in various versions and stages. For a more detailed discussion, see the relevant volume of the New Liszt Edition (Suppl. 6; Z. A/B 14504).

In 1834, Liszt wrote a single piece called Harmonies poétiques et religieuses (S. 154; LW A18; R. 13), which was published soon after.

In the years following, Liszt explored extending this work to a cycle. He left many related drafts, including Prière d’un enfant à son réveil (S. 171c), Litanies de Marie (S. 171e), and, as a sequence of eight pieces in the so-called Tasso sketchbook, Préludes et Harmonies poétiques et religieuses (S. 171d).

In 1847 and 1848, Liszt re-visited the concept and prepared a draft called Harmonies poétiques et religieuses (S. 172a; LW A61); eleven movements are still extant. He further revised this to create a final version (S. 173; LW A158; R. 14) that was published in 1853.

The below table gives a summary of the relationships between the works.

S. 173/S. 172a/S. 171d/S.

1. Prélude

Duration: 4' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

2. C minor

Duration: 7' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

3. E major

Duration: 5'

Difficulty: 3.5

4. Dernière illusion

This piece is incomplete. Liszt later re-worked it as the Ballade no. 1 in D-flat major (S. 170; LW A 117; R. 15). He also wrote multiple album leaves on the main theme: at least four in A-flat major (S. 189a/1; LW A116) and one in D-flat major (S. 189a/2).

Duration: 11'

Difficulty: 4.5

5. G-flat major

Duration: 6' 30"

Difficulty: 4

6. Attente

This piece is incomplete.

Duration: 4'

Difficulty: 3.5

7. Alternative

Liszt’s song for voice and piano Gestorben war ich (S. 308; LW N18/2; R. 588) exists in many versions for solo piano. It is most familiar as the second piece, Seliger Tod, of the Liebesträume (S. 541; LW A103; R. 211), which has a related, simpler version (S. 540a; R. 211). Liszt also prepared an incomplete version as Alternative (no. 7) from the Préludes et Harmonies poétiques et religieuses (S. 171d). Many years later, he prepared a further version as the first of the Fünf Klavierstücke (S. 192; LW A233; R. 60).

Duration: 1' 30"

Difficulty: 2

8. M. K.

This piece is incomplete.

Duration: 1'

Difficulty: 2
